subject: Cybersecurity
title: Active Directory: The Corporate Gatekeeper
description: One-minute skill: Active Directory: The Corporate Gatekeeper.

hook.text: When a company of 50,000 employees needs to control who accesses what, one system manages it all: Active Directory.

buildup.text: AD stores user accounts, group memberships, and access policies. It authenticates employees and controls.

discovery.text: Kerberos authentication in AD uses time-limited tickets. You prove identity once and get tickets for specific services.

twist.text: Compromising AD is the 'holy grail' for attackers. The 2020 SolarWinds attack specifically targeted AD to create.

climax.text: Active Directory is the single most critical system in corporate security. Owning AD means owning all organization.

punchline.text: Control the directory, control the company.

quiz.question: Why is Active Directory a prime target for attackers?
options: Compromising AD grants control over all user accounts and resource access
It's always exposed to the internet
